Pre_Colonial_Period.Description: Before the British colonial period, the North-Eastern region of India was inhabited by various ethnic groups with independent kingdoms and tribal lands.

Treaty_of_Yandabo.Description: The British East India Company gained control over Assam following the Treaty of Yandabo, marking the start of colonial rule in the region.

Assam_Formation.Description: Assam became part of the Indian Union after India gained independence in 1947. It was the largest state in the North-East region, and many of the other states were originally part of Assam.

Nagaland.Description: Nagaland was carved out of Assam and became a separate state due to ethnic insurgency and demands for sovereignty.

Meghalaya.Description: Meghalaya gained statehood after demands for greater autonomy from Assam, due to cultural and linguistic differences.

Manipur_Tripura_Statehood.Description: Manipur and Tripura, formerly princely states, became full-fledged states of India after being union territories post-independence.

Arunachal_Pradesh.Description: Arunachal Pradesh was granted full statehood due to its strategic location bordering China and its unique ethnic composition.

Mizoram.Description: Mizoram was given statehood following a peace accord in 1986 between the Indian government and insurgent groups demanding independence.

Reasons_for_Separation_and_Statehood.Ethnic_Diversity: The North-East is home to numerous ethnic groups with distinct languages and cultures. This diversity led to demands for greater autonomy and separate states.
Reasons_for_Separation_and_Statehood.Insurgency: Several regions, especially Nagaland and Mizoram, witnessed armed insurgencies demanding independence, leading to their eventual separation and statehood.
Reasons_for_Separation_and_Statehood.Geopolitical_Strategic_Importance: The North-East borders several countries, including China, Myanmar, and Bangladesh, making it strategically important for Indiaâ€™s security. The Indian government granted statehood to these regions partly to ensure better governance and integration.
